text: May this solemn day always renew our courage and strength to stand up for the universal right to life, dignity and peace – for every person, everywhere. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/ohmjR6zr19

In 2019, the Congress voted to recognize that the violence inflicted on the Armenian people constituted a genocide: a bold statement of America's commitment to human rights & truth. Last year, @POTUS made history by echoing that powerful message from our nation’s highest office.
Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day shines a light on a monstrous truth while honoring those murdered and those who survived unspeakable horror.

Today, the world solemnly marks 107 years since the Ottoman Empire began an inhuman campaign of mass murder and devastation: a genocide that stole the lives of 1.5 million Armenian men, women and children.
May it be a comfort to his wife Elaine, their six beloved children and their many grandchildren and great-grandchildren that so many pray for them at this sad time.

Congress and the Country join Utah in mourning the passing of former Senator Orrin Hatch.
 
The longest-serving Republican in the Senate's history, he devoted more than four decades to public service — often working across the aisle on behalf of America’s families.

Democrats will not relent until we realize @POTUS’ ambitious vision of slashing carbon pollution in half by 2030 & achieving a carbon neutral economy by 2050.

This evening, Jewish communities in America and around the world mark the beginning of #Passover: a season of renewal and resilience filled with symbolism and meaning. From my family to yours, chag sameach.

Today, we mark one year since eight Americans were killed in a mass shooting at an Indianapolis FedEx facility. Of the eight victims, four were Sikh Americans. Democrats remain committed to ending the fear and anguish of gun violence for all Americans. #RememberingIndianapolis

In California and across the nation, we welcome all to be part of the American Dream and celebrate those who make the United States their home. It is in this spirit of E Pluribus Unum that I wish Thai and Lao Americans a wonderful and happy #Songkran. Happy New Year!

My office is working closely with @LondonBreed & @POTUS to support Laguna Honda’s devoted staff & ensure that the hospital can address its issues, come into full compliance & continue to serve our community for decades to come. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/SB1IOPnvs7

It is unfathomable that Laguna Honda could lose the vital federal funding it needs to support life-saving programs for some of our most vulnerable San Franciscans — especially as we continue to be threatened by the pandemic.

Laguna Honda Hospital has long been a pillar of the health & well-being for generations of San Francisco families. It is both urgent & essential that city, state & national officials work together to help address areas of concern & protect this crucial health care provider.

Small businesses are the lifeblood of America’s economy and are powering our recovery from the pandemic.
 
Last week, @HouseDemocrats passed bipartisan legislation to support restaurants and other hard-hit small businesses with $55 billion in pandemic recovery assistance.

In March, America created 431,000 jobs & slashed unemployment to 3.6% — reaching near pre-pandemic levels faster than any experts predicted.

.@HouseDemocrats & @POTUS know that Putin’s Price Hike is weighing heavily on America’s families – and we remain laser-focused on #BuildingABetterAmerica: with lower costs, bigger paychecks & more jobs for all of our families. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/gIArCFJ5ls

The Administration’s new action builds on bold steps in recent weeks to bring down gas prices, including by ordering an historic release from our Strategic Petroleum Reserve and working with our allies to secure releases from strategic reserves around the world.

This homegrown biofuel is a cleaner, cheaper fuel option: helping save families money at the pump & moving us closer to energy independence. Big Oil must join us in this effort by adding Unleaded 88 to more pumps & gas stations, rather than put profits above the American people.

Today, @POTUS took new action to bring down prices at the pump by propelling the development of homegrown ethanol: a powerful tool to fight Putin’s Price Hike. 
 
Doing so will reduce our dependence on foreign oil and empower America’s farmers to help fight Putin’s Price Hike.

Today, happily I tested negative for COVID. Tomorrow, I will be exiting isolation at the direction of the Capitol’s Attending Physician and consistent with CDC guidelines for asymptomatic individuals. Many thanks to everyone for their good wishes, chocolates and chicken soup.

As a daughter of Italy, I am proud of the enduring partnership that the Italian-American community has helped forge between our two nations.
 
Today, and every day, let us commit to preserving that precious bond for generations to come.
Today, America celebrates 161 years of diplomatic relations with Italy – one of our most cherished friends and closest allies in the fight to defend democracy and promote peace around the world.

With the help of @POTUS and @HouseDemocrats, our nation has created 7.9 million new jobs, unemployment has dropped to 3.6% and workers’ wages are on the rise. 

Now, we’re laser-focused on building on this historic recovery by working to lower costs for families.

More Americans are getting hired with 431,000 jobs created last month– and we’re #BuildingABetterAmerica in the wake of the pandemic. 

To continue this strong jobs recovery, @HouseDemocrats are working to lower costs and increase wages. https://t.co/K0yBOk24cy

I’m overwhelmed with the wonderful well wishes and prayers, and thank everyone for the kindness. I remain asymptomatic thanks to the robust protection from the vaccinations and boosters, which I encourage everyone to get.

As last month's jobs report showed, our nation has built a strong recovery: creating 7.9 million new jobs since @POTUS took office.

Democrats are focusing on lowering costs, growing paychecks and creating jobs for families while ensuring the richest few pay their fair share.

Making the COMPETES Act law will deliver a key victory for our workers and families, while ensuring America can outcompete any nation – now and for decades to come. Read the full list of Members who will go to conference over the America COMPETES Act here: https://t.co/b5b57blu0b

Under the leadership of our committee chairs and conferees, the House will champion key priorities including investing $52 billion to make more semiconductor chips in America & $45 billion to advance manufacturing at home — addressing supply chain disruptions that increase costs.

Today, we take another step toward sending to the President’s desk a bipartisan, bicameral package to lower costs at home, make more goods in America and turbocharge our competitiveness in the world by announcing the Conference Committee for the America COMPETES Act of 2022.

With Judge Jackson’s historic confirmation, our nation takes an important step toward realizing our most cherished ideals.  On behalf of the House, we wish her all the best as she continues her devoted public service. https://t.co/KIWzT6yXJe

On the bench, Judge Jackson will be a relentless defender of individual rights and the rule of law.  American families will greatly benefit from her extensive courtroom experience and background as a public defender that she will bring to the Court.

During her nomination process, Judge Jackson demonstrated the magnificence of her legal mind, unyielding commitment to justice & remarkable poise. In her appearances before the Judiciary Committee & in meetings with Senators, she earned bipartisan recognition of her excellence.
Today is a day of great pride and patriotism for our nation, as Judge Ketanji Brown Jackson makes history as the first Black woman to be confirmed to the Supreme Court.

The House also passed the Ukraine War Crimes Act to ensure that perpetrators can be brought to justice. America is unwavering in our commitment to the Ukrainian people, and the Congress will continue to hold Russia to account. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/8NJ3vKs1WY

Putin’s aggression and barbaric war crimes have horrified the world and demand a strong response. Since the start, the United States Congress has taken action to punish Russia, choke off the Russian economy and support Ukraine, including through $13.6 billion in assistance.

Today, the Congress took strong action to hold Russia accountable for its unprovoked, premeditated war against Ukraine. By again voting to ban the import of Russian oil and suspend normal trade relations, the House is sending to @POTUS’ desk additional action to isolate Russia.

Democrats are #BuildingABetterAmerica For The People – and we will never relent in our fight to bring down the burdensome health costs weighing heavy on America’s families. Read my full statement here: https://t.co/sk4yCEjZHB

Thanks to @POTUS & @HouseDemocrats, health care is more affordable & accessible than ever.

Our Rescue Plan saved families an average of $2,400 last year. And we are fighting to slash prescription drug prices, including by capping out-of-pocket insulin costs at $35/month.

By delivering affordable coverage to families who only have unaffordable coverage options at work, we put more money in families' pockets and realize a key priority of the Patient Protection & Affordable Care Enhancement Act passed by the House Democratic Majority in 2020.

.@POTUS Biden’s Executive Order today is a powerful step to lower families’ health costs. With this bold action to #ProtectOurCare, nearly a million Americans will see lower premiums & hundreds of thousands of uninsured Americans will gain affordable coverage.

The House has taken action to combat religious & racial discrimination, passing the NO BAN Act & Access to Counsel Act last year to protect civil rights & prevent executive abuses of authority. We must honor our nation’s promise & send religious bigotry to the dustbin of history.

Despite the invaluable contributions of Muslim Americans, Islamophobia continues to threaten our Muslim communities and undermine Americans’ most cherished national values, with hate crimes against Muslims on the rise in recent years.

For generations, America’s large and diverse Muslim communities have been essential to our nation’s success: whether serving on the frontlines of the pandemic, advancing the fight against injustice in our communities or enriching our cultural tapestry.

Read My Full Statement on César Chávez Day
https://t.co/XSVqQyvVHL

As Americans celebrate César Chávez’s remarkable achievements, let his example inspire our shared fight to defend the fundamental rights & dignities of working people. Today, & every day, we proudly stand with our partners in the labor movement as we work to #BuildaBetterAmerica.

While Democrats continue fighting to enact these urgently needed reforms, our Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is delivering historic investments to communities across the country – creating good-paying union jobs with Davis-Bacon prevailing wage protections.
House Democrats have also twice passed the Richard L. Trumka PRO Act to reform our nation’s outdated labor laws and strengthen Americans’ right to join a union.

Building on Chávez’s legendary advocacy, House Democrats have taken action to ensure that nobody who works to feed our country is limited to permanent second class status, twice passing the bipartisan Farm Workforce Modernization Act.

Today, Californians and all Americans honor César Chávez, a fearless champion for justice and a tireless civil rights activist.  Chávez was an icon of the modern labor movement, leading the United Farm Workers’ fight for better pay and protections against exploitation.

This bold fiscal blueprint proposes deeply needed investments in communities across the country to help lower the everyday costs weighing on families, grow workers’ paychecks and create good-paying jobs – all while ensuring the wealthiest few pay their fair share.

Secretary Albright truly blessed our nation with her pioneering and patriotic service. Read my full statement on the passing of Secretary Madeleine Albright:
https://t.co/itDDUQhpaF

Secretary Albright’s family arrived in Ellis Island as refugees in 1948, and she rose to become a barrier-breaking leader on the world stage.  She was a force in advancing America’s security, and her warnings about the rise of autocracy remain a guide for us today.

Today, we lost a towering champion for peace, diplomacy and democracy: Secretary Madeleine Albright.
 
As the first woman to serve as our top diplomat, she paved the way for generations of women serving at the highest levels of government and representing our nation abroad.

In the face of these cruel Republican attacks, Democrats will never relent in our fight to defend working families. Today, werenew our commitment to #BuildingaBetterAmerica and lowering health care costs and prescription drug prices.
https://t.co/BRYBOWmi3f
Meanwhile, Republicans continue to promise to wage a shameful assault on the Affordable Care Act, threatening to rip away protections and coverage from millions of working families.
Last year, amid the darkness of the pandemic, Democrats took action to expand the promise of the Affordable Care Act to lower health costs even further for millions more families.

The Affordable Care Act stands alongside Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security as a pillar of health and financial security – especially for the 130 million Americans living with pre-existing conditions, who now enjoy life-saving protections.
Today, our nation celebrates this landmark law’s essential role in safeguarding Americans’ health and preserving families’ hard-earned savings through quality, affordable insurance.
Twelve years ago, when President Obama signed the #AffordableCareAct into law, our nation took an historic step toward fulfilling a fundamental promise: that health care is a right, not a privilege.

.@SenSchumer and I are pleased to announce that the Congress has reached an historic bipartisan omnibus appropriations agreement #ForThePeople. This bipartisan agreement will help us address many of the major challenges we face at home and abroad.

On a bipartisan & bicameral basis, the Congress will continue to work with the Administration to take every potential action to limit the costs of Putin’s aggression on American families — focusing on ensuring the stability of global oil markets & diversifying our energy supply.

Our bill has three major provisions: it will ban the import of Russian oil & energy products into the U.S., it will take steps to review Russia’s access to the WTO and explore how we can diminish Russia in the global economy & it will reauthorize & strengthen the Magnitsky Act.

Today, the House will pass strong, bipartisan legislation to hold Putin accountable for his unprovoked war against Ukraine. In doing so, we support @POTUS actions to ban Russian energy products and demonstrate America’s strength and determination.

Addressing the debt limit is about meeting obligations the government has already made, like the bipartisan emergency COVID relief legislation from December as well as vital payments to Social Security recipients and our veterans.

A suspension of the debt limit through 12/22 would provide an amount of time commensurate w/ the debt incurred as a result of passing last winter’s bipartisan $908B emergency COVID relief legislation, which was authored by GOP Senators & signed into law by the previous president.

The legislation to avoid a government shutdown will also include a suspension of the debt limit through December 2022 to once again meet our obligations and protect the full faith and credit of the United States.

This week, the House of Representatives will pass legislation to fund the government through December of this year to avoid a needless government shutdown that would harm American families and our economic recovery before the September 30th deadline.

From food security to paid family leave, the bipartisan #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act, which we vote on tonight, is focused on delivering support to families across America as we confront this public health crisis. https://t.co/QFbrOVw8td
As the Senate works to pass #FamiliesFirst, the House will begin work on a third emergency response package to protect the health, economic security and well-being of the American people.

For families’ health security, #FamiliesFirst increases federal funds for Medicaid to support our local, state, tribal and territorial governments and health systems, so that they have the resources necessary to combat this crisis.

For families’ food security, #FamiliesFirst strengthens nutrition security initiatives such as SNAP, student meals, seniors’ nutrition & food banks. 22 million children rely on free or reduced-price school meals for their food security; we must ensure that they have food to eat.

For families’ economic security, #FamiliesFirst secures paid emergency leave with two weeks of paid sick leave and up to three months of paid family and medical leave. We have also secured enhanced Unemployment insurance for those who lose their jobs.
#FamiliesFirst is about testing, testing, testing. To stop the spread of the virus, we have secured free #coronavirus testing for everyone who needs a test, including the uninsured.

Today, we will pass the Families First Coronavirus Response Act after reaching an agreement with the Administration. This legislation builds on the action that House Democrats took last week to put #FamiliesFirst with our strong, bipartisan $8.3 billion emergency funding package.
